content: Hi! I need 1$ Loan. The payment will be returned by me in a month in the amount of $1.05

comments.author: coupable
comments.body: Quote from: 16xypjnxlrew on June 02, 2022, 08:18:30 AMHi! I need 1$ Loan. The payment will be returned by me in a month in the amount of $1.05Are you kidding ?And for what you need this big amount ? You need a valid collateral. Lol

comments.author: 16xypjnxlrew
comments.body: Quote from: coupable on June 02, 2022, 09:01:25 AMAre you kidding ?And for what you need this big amount ? You need a valid collateral. LolI need a loan to buy a LUNA because it will grow 10 times. Can I use UST tokens as collateral?

comments.author: DireWolfM14
comments.body: Quote from: 16xypjnxlrew on June 02, 2022, 04:49:51 PMQuote from: coupable on June 02, 2022, 09:01:25 AMAre you kidding ?And for what you need this big amount ? You need a valid collateral. LolI need a loan to buy a LUNA because it will grow 10 times. Can I use UST tokens as collateral?Under normal circumstances I would be 99% certain this is trolling, but after looking at your post history I'm not so sure.  You might actually be serious.  Why don't you just buy Luna directly with your Terra tokens?  Anyway, the transaction fees are more than the interest you've offered, so even with collateral it's not something likely to happen.

comments.author: 16xypjnxlrew
comments.body: Quote from: DireWolfM14 on June 02, 2022, 05:11:35 PMUnder normal circumstances I would be 99% certain this is trolling, but after looking at your post history I'm not so sure.  You might actually be serious.  Why don't you just buy Luna directly with your Terra tokens?  Anyway, the transaction fees are more than the interest you've offered, so even with collateral it's not something likely to happen.I'm afraid to sell UST because it could recover to $1

comments.author: DireWolfM14
comments.body: Quote from: 16xypjnxlrew on June 02, 2022, 05:16:36 PMI'm afraid to sell UST because it could recover to $1Hahahaha!  Okay, so this is a joke.  A funny one.  Good job.Post a bitcoin address, I'll give you a dollar just because you made me laugh.

comments.author: Little Mouse
comments.body: Quote from: 16xypjnxlrew on June 02, 2022, 05:16:36 PMI'm afraid to sell UST because it could recover to $1That's unlikely. If it was possible to get recovered, we wouldn’t see Luna Classic and Version 2.0. Also, for your info, Luna Version 2.0 is another of the same quality product as it was. This will also have the same future as of the old Luna. Be careful, you better sell your UST and get $1 as in future, they are most likely to get more devalued.

comments.author: 16xypjnxlrew
comments.body: Hi! I urgently need 500 USDT to participate in the bybit contest to win 20 usd. Until 23:59 UTC 8 june 2022

comments.author: DireWolfM14
comments.body: Quote from: 16xypjnxlrew on June 04, 2022, 03:16:32 PMHi! I urgently need 500 USDT to participate in the bybit contest to win 20 usd. Until 23:59 UTC 8 june 2022Just a few days ago you urgently needed $1, now it's $500?  If you're so broke that you need to scrounge for a single dollar, who in their right minds would lend your $500?  How on earth do you plan on paying that back?  And, all so you can participate in a contest to win $20?  Instead of placing all your hopes on winning 20 measly dollars or wasting your time begging for handouts on the internet, why don't you try getting a job?

comments.author: 16xypjnxlrew
comments.body: Quote from: DireWolfM14 on June 04, 2022, 08:26:29 PMJust a few days ago you urgently needed $1, now it's $500?  If you're so broke that you need to scrounge for a single dollar, who in their right minds would lend your $500?  How on earth do you plan on paying that back?  And, all so you can participate in a contest to win $20?  Instead of placing all your hopes on winning 20 measly dollars or wasting your time begging for handouts on the internet, why don't you try getting a job?Thanks for the dollar, but I found out about this promotion a few hours ago. The filled funds are not spent, the promotion states that when replenishing in the amount of $500, they give 20 USDD Justin Sun

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: Quote from: 16xypjnxlrew on June 05, 2022, 01:38:15 AMQuote from: DireWolfM14 on June 04, 2022, 08:26:29 PMJust a few days ago you urgently needed $1, now it's $500?  If you're so broke that you need to scrounge for a single dollar, who in their right minds would lend your $500?  How on earth do you plan on paying that back?  And, all so you can participate in a contest to win $20?  Instead of placing all your hopes on winning 20 measly dollars or wasting your time begging for handouts on the internet, why don't you try getting a job?Thanks for the dollar, but I found out about this promotion a few hours ago. The filled funds are not spent, the promotion states that when replenishing in the amount of $500, they give 20 USDD Justin SunI can give you a $500 loan, but you need to repay me in 7 days, that $500 amount plus $50 of interest. Transactions fees are on your side.Is it okay for you?Whether you did a search at all, whether Bybit is a reliable service? have you checked the reactions to them and the feedback that can be seen?I understand that you will easily take risks and spend other people's money, but do you want to be associated with a potential scam?

comments.author: 16xypjnxlrew
comments.body: Quote from: examplens on June 06, 2022, 01:22:55 PMI can give you a $500 loan, but you need to repay me in 7 days, that $500 amount plus $50 of interest. Transactions fees are on your side.Is it okay for you?Whether you did a search at all, whether Bybit is a reliable service? have you checked the reactions to them and the feedback that can be seen?I understand that you will easily take risks and spend other people's money, but do you want to be associated with a potential scam?Thanks for the offer, but I'll decline. After all, bybit will give only $20, it cannot immediately close the commission and interest on the loan. I am registered on bybit exchange and passed KYC, but they did not return the UST peg to $1, so my deposit was stuck in UST candy wrappers

comments.author: 16xypjnxlrew
comments.body: Hi everyone! A copper member DireWoIfM14 demanded me to return a non-existent loan amount of $1,999.91, but he sent the loan to a different address. Say it's legal? Is this a scam? What should I do? Should I look for a good lawyer? Help me URGENTLY, I'm in shock
